Kris,

Thanks for the dialog.  The details are getting clearer to me.

Particularly this:

> Again, nothing you couldn't modify the BDBFrontier to do, it just
> doesn't make sense to try and make it do everything. For a typical
> snapshot crawl, covering tens of thousands of domains and tens if not
> hundred of millions of URIs, it just doesn't make any sense to encumber
> it with managing time of next fetch etc. when FIFO does the job
> perfectly well.

How big a crawl do you think you could do iteratively with ARFrontier?
Could it iterate over 10^6 domains with 10^8 documents every couple days
with the same hardware that BDBFrontier would require?

Eventually, I'd like to get Heritrix to the point that it can iterate over
even larger private networks.
